rsa_ml_attacks.name: RSA ML Attacks
rsa_ml_attacks.short_description: Investigating the attacks on the RSA encryption algorithm using maching learning

blocks.value: is a research project I created to explore how machine learning can be used to analyze and challenge the security of RSA encryption, one of the most widely used cryptographic algorithms in the world.

The goal of this project is to investigate whether patterns in RSA-related data can be learned by machine learning models and potentially used to perform or assist in cryptographic attacks. It sits at the intersection of artificial intelligence and cybersecurity.

This work is meant to contribute to the academic and technical understanding of how modern AI techniques might influence cryptographic security, either by revealing new vulnerabilities or inspiring more robust encryption strategies.
Researchers interested in the intersection of cryptography and machine learning.
Students studying cybersecurity, cryptanalysis, or data science.
Developers and academics curious about how AI could be applied in cryptographic contexts.

kibit.name: Kibit
kibit.short_description: A version controlled file saving system

blocks.value: is a Git backup tool I developed using the Kivy framework. It provides a graphical user interface (GUI) to facilitate easy backup of local Git repositories to a remote repository.

The primary objective of Kibit is to simplify the process of backing up local files and folders by offering an intuitive interface that allows users to configure and manage their backup settings effortlessly.
Kibit is designed for anyone who prefer a Git-powered version control system on their personal files, eliminating the need to look for a backup device.
Offers a simple and intuitive GUI built with the Kivy framework, making it accessible to users of all technical levels.
Allows users to set up and configure their private Git repositories for backup purposes.
Provides options to set relative paths, offering flexibility in managing backup locations.

bcl.name: Blockchain Conflict Law (BCL)
bcl.short_description: BCL is a web-based tool that helps identify the applicable law for international cryptocurrency transactions under private international law.

blocks.value: is a web-based interactive tool developed under the TÜBİTAK 1002 project. It aims to assist in determining the applicable law for cryptocurrency trading transactions in private international law.

This platform provides guidance on jurisdictional issues related to crypto transactions, offering users insights into potential legal frameworks. However, it does not provide definitive legal advice or binding recommendations.

Designed for legal professionals, researchers, and individuals interested in the intersection of cryptocurrency and international law, BCL_public serves as an informative resource in this emerging field.
Allows users to input relevant details to explore potential legal jurisdictions for crypto transactions.
Provides insights into applicable laws based on user inputs, aiding in understanding jurisdictional complexities.
Clarifies that the tool offers informational content and does not constitute legal advice or binding recommendations.

tech_notary.name: Tech Notary
tech_notary.short_description: Tech Notary is a mobile application created for a demostraction of a public notary system built on a custom blockchain system

blocks.value: is a mobile application that is developed to combine the notary and signature related tasks with the online public signature system, blockchain.

The primary objective of Tech Notary is to make the notary tasks much easy to do. Using this application, Users can create a document and make it signed by an available notary at the time. Also user can include multiple parties to a document and when the included parties also approved the document, the document can be signable a notary and when the notary approves the document, it will be added the blockchain and will be available to the public to see.
The mobile application, built with Flutter, delivers a seamless and responsive user experience with fast performance and a consistent UI across both iOS and Android platforms.
The mobile application features a smooth document upload and display system, allowing users to easily upload files from their device and view them directly within the app.
The application leverages blockchain technology to ensure undeniability by securely recording document uploads with immutable timestamps and tamper-proof verification.

The application implements role-based authentication, providing different authentication systems tailored to each party—such as users, notaries, and verifiers—ensuring secure and appropriate access control for all stakeholders.

dr-bst.name: DRLearning Basket Shot Trajectory (DR-BST)
dr-bst.short_description: DRLearning Basket Shot Trajectory (DR-BST) is a deep reinforcement learning-based simulation that trains an agent to optimize basketball shot trajectories through dynamic angle and force adjustments.

blocks.value: is a physics simulation project I developed to model and analyze the trajectory of a basketball shot. The project aims to provide insights into the factors influencing the success of a basketball shot.
By simulating various parameters such as angle, velocity, and trajectory, this project offers a deeper understanding of the mechanics behind a successful basketball shot.
This project is intended for sports enthusiasts, students, and anyone interested in the physics of basketball shooting.
Models the trajectory of a basketball shot considering various physical factors.
Deep reinforcement learning agent adjusts parameters like angle and velocity to get more points and by doing so improve its success on the shot trajectory.
Serves as an educational resource for understanding the physics behind basketball shooting.

sli-checker.name: SLI Checker
sli-checker.short_description: SLI Checker is a lightweight Python tool that helps detect and prevent unauthorized or suspicious external links on websites to protect against spam link injection attacks.

blocks.value: is a Python-based tool developed to identify and mitigate Spam Link Injection (SLI) attacks on websites. It automates the detection of unauthorized or malicious links injected into web pages, which can be exploited for spam or phishing purposes.

The primary objective of SLI-Checker is to provide web administrators and security professionals with a reliable method to scan and identify potential SLI vulnerabilities within their websites, ensuring the integrity and trustworthiness of their online presence.
This tool is designed for use by web developers, security analysts, and administrators who are responsible for maintaining the security and integrity of websites.
Scans web pages to identify unauthorized or malicious links that may have been injected through various attack vectors.
Allows administrators to define a list of trusted links and domains, enabling the tool to distinguish between legitimate and suspicious links.
Generates detailed reports highlighting detected SLI threats, including the source and nature of the suspicious links.
